subject: p15259244
History: Kidney transplant with CHF and respiratory distress.
Findings: In comparison with study of, there is increasing bilateral pulmonary opacifications consistent with worsening effusions, consistent with volume loss, and worsening pulmonary vascular congestion. The possibility of supervening pneumonia must be seriously considered in the appropriate clinical setting, and is difficult to evaluate due to the substrate of extensive pulmonary changes. Dual-channel catheter, presumably due for hemodialysis ends in the right atrium.
